Topic.Title: Pumperz...... Sybil thinks that we should slow down in our relationship and find balance in our livez

Message.Msg: Sybil on 7/10/2013: "You see, sybil has covered 7800 sharez of amzn at an average of a whopping 290.00. . . .Now for the good newz: sybil in return has SHORTED an additional 2600 sharez of phat pig crash your discount airplane seats in the middle of a pumper upgrade PCLN at a WHOPPING 893.00...." Is it really good news? If you didn't do anything yesterday. You would have lost another $42,120 on 7800 shares of AMZN shorted ($42120 = $5.40 [ 295.40 - 290] x 7800). You prevented that by covering 7800 shares yesterday. PCLN's ask now is 900. So, you've lost $7 a share. $7 x 2800 = $19600. Yes, Sybil, it's good news! By covering 7800 shares of AMZN short at 290 and shorting 2800 shares of PCLN at 893 yesterday was a good move! You cut the loss overnight by more than half!

Message.Msg: LIKE THEY STOLE HOMES NOW THEY WILL NOT LEAVE A PENNY IN YOUR PENSIONS MASSIVE RIOTS IN USA 2014.....ROME DID NOT BURN IN A DAY FINAL FRAUD PHASE WITH BERNANKE FREE FRAUD MONEY FOR BANKSTERS TO RAPE AMERICAN 99% “I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies.” – Thomas Jefferson If the American people ever allow private banks to control the issue of their currency, first by inflation, then by deflation, the banks…will deprive the people of all property until their children wake-up homeless on the continent their fathers conquered…. The issuing power should be taken from the banks and restored to the people, to whom it properly belongs. – Thomas Jefferson in the debate over the Re-charter of the Bank Bill (1809) Andrew Jackson : Gentlemen, I have had men watching you for a long time and I am convinced that you have used the funds of the bank to speculate in the breadstuffs of the country. When you won, you divided the profits amongst you, and when you lost, you charged it to the bank. You tell me that if I take the deposits from the bank and annul its charter, I shall ruin ten thousand families. That may be true, gentlemen, but that is your sin! Should I let you go on, you will ruin fifty thousand families, and that would be my sin! You are a den of vipers and thieves. DAVID STOCKMAN: We've Been Lied To, Robbed, And Misled

Message.Title: Poor Sybil
Message.Msg: Sybil is an anti-semite and for that I am appalled at him. However, wirth regard to AMZN, PCLN, NFLX, AZO, LNKD. CMG he is right. Anyone with eyes can see the valuations are beyond absurd. Yet, since the main objective of the funds who control the stock movement is to prove to "everyone else on the outside" that they (the funds) know better, and that means that one can't just trade stocks without their expertise, then of course they bid up such stocks as these till most shorts are financially ruined. Once retail shorts have covered at a loss tey can then no longer make any claims of successfully trading via simple fundamental analyzing, and that ipso factso proves that the only way to invest in stocks is via professional funds doing the trading for you. If you need further evidence of this fact, you can find many other stocks that have low PE ratios yet are trading at closer to year lows than highs even with all this stimulus talk and the indexes trading at near all time and multi year highs. Why aren't all boats floating as high? Why in fact are many stocks still in a sink hole even with all the stimulus, while others trade at close to all time highs? The answer is obvious: Funds are out to "prove" to everyone outside of themselves that they are the stock trading genius's that everyone else needs, i.e. it is impossible to trade on your own based upon simple fundamental analysis. So, Sybil is correct in terms of his fundamental analysis. But since it is the goal of the funds to prove him and others like him wrong via making him lose on this sthort positions, he still ends up getting hammered. Also, the fact that Sybil at least claims to have made huge profits shorting last year made him head strong in believing that he would always eventually win, thus encouraging him to go even heavier on new short positions, thus ultimately giving the funds the ability to take even more (if not all) of his money.

Topic.Title: amazon is the scam of the year

Message.Msg: I recall several years ago on Nightly Business Report they interviewed some pro about the bad shape that the airline industry was in. I kind of wondered what prompted them to suddenly bring up the issue. Soon after the interview which stressed the poor shape that many airlines were in, most if not all of the airline stocks started to move to all time highs. For example, AMR went from $1/share to $40/share! Suddenly there were nearly daily stories about mergers and other wonderful things in the industry. And yet nothing fundamental had changed all the while. Do ya think that the NBR story was done to lure in retail shorts on airline stocks? Yes, eventually those stocks were dumped and tanked hard, but how many retail shorts got taken before that happened? Or perhaps you trust that the stock industry is one that cares about the welfare of the public?

Message.Title: Hey, there are some coins worth hundreds, thousands, even millions of dollars

Message.Title: AMZN vs WMT valutaion, profits and revenues
Message.Msg: Amazing. AMZN now has a market cap of $160 billion with revenues of $60 billion and no profits (give or take $1 billion, because AMZN results are all over the place). Walmart has a market cap of $240 billion and does revenues of $470 billion and $17 billion in profits. In the last two year, Walmart has increased its revenues by $50 billion, almost the size of AMZN in total. AMZN's shareholders equity is only $8 billion, versus $76 billion for Walmart. These figures are remarkable, but interesting thing is that everyone knows them as they are all out there in the open. Nonetheless, it seems like no one really cares. It is all about perceived revenue growth and everyone must be thinking that AMZN will simply overrun Walmart over time. I have thought for the past couple of years that AMZN had reached overvalued levels, but the share have gone higher. I am not sure if the market and investors will overall change their view on AMZN. It will probably take a noticeable revenue disappointment generate a share price correction. WMT generates about a 3% after tax profit margin. If AMZN gets to $100 mill in revenues and gets to WMT margins, its earnings would be $3 billion on a $160 billion market cap....a p/e of over 50 times (and $100 mill in revenues and 3% margin see a ways off).

Message.Title: AWS - $100 B valuation in 3 yr
Message.Msg: AMZN knows now to drive costs down in the IT outsourcing space. There are several juggernauts in the cloud computing space, but it looks as though Amazon (AMZN) Web Services will remain the top dog for the foreseeable future. According to a Morgan Stanley report on the cloud provider, total annual revenue for AWS will skyrocket to $24 billion by 2022, representing a significant portion of a $152 billion addressable market.

For instance, with AMZN, many times you merely short all the way untilthe direction changes the hgher high runs of 50 or more points while carrying many old shorts back up with the price. In doing that, you dodge nothing, you carry marked down short values as AMZN goes up. NO dodging whats so ever. You are completely delusional.

Topic.Title: I can't fully express how happy I am

Message.Msg: The market will play this as long as it can be played. No news is bad news for AMZN right now; thus it will keep going up as long as there are suckers to buy it. It has been going up for a long time, when resistance builds against more buying and the statistics tells the big traders and their algorithms that there is more to make to sell short than to buy long; the "unpredictable" dumping happens so fast that no "retail long" can recover fast enough; your money in the end belongs to them no matter what. Yes, if you are lucky, some of you will make money, but in the end, more lose than gain; that is the only way wall street can get richer; with your money! I would not touch a stock like AMZN when fundamentals don't support such a high price /valuation but it keeps going up; obviously it is manipulated by folks much bigger than you and I. Short or long, you will lose money, unless you have a crystal ball. In this manipulated market, always be long with stocks that their fundamentals are sound; their balance sheets are clean, and their income statements are not "made up" to look good. Good luck!

Topic.Title: amazon-suckers game for shorts- read below

Message.Msg: "Short could win hold the stock short for couple of years" But at what price? 300? 400? The short churning here is minor compare to the pumping by banks and analysts to get the funds to sink their teeth into. It's easy to say when the market is at the all time high and everyone is uber bullish. But when the market changes mood, Scamazon will be the emperor without clothes. It's herding mentality at its finest and the herd [or the latest one to join] usually get slaughtered. I short stock on sentiment and anticipation of sentiment change not valuation BTW. But after such a rubbish run like this, it is way overdue to give back some. So I'll take what they'll give while waiting for pay dirt and I do have a lot of time.
